question: Why do wolves howl?
answer: Yes, wolves howl for several reasons. They may howl to communicate with other wolves in their pack, to strengthen social bonds, or to warn off rival packs. Wolves also howl to mark territory and to locate each other
contexts: Context: . Wolves also growl at other wolves while being aggressively dominant. Wolves bark when nervous or when they want to warn other wolves of danger  .
